Token count must be at least 1: Token count must be at least 1
Ballot tokens allow voters to access the: Ballot tokens allow voters to access their unique voting page. Share these links individually or export all as CSV.
Important: Each token should be shared w: Important: Each token should be shared with exactly one person. Tokens are unique to each voter and should not be reused or shared publicly.
No ballot tokens have been created yet.
Admin Guide meta description: Complete guide for election administrators. Learn how to create elections, generate ballot tokens, distribute them to voters, and publish results.
Set the title, description, candidates,: Set the title, description, candidates, number of seats, and start/end dates.
When you create an election, you'll rece: When you create an election, you'll receive a unique admin page URL. Save this link and share it only with other trusted administrators.
On the admin page, generate ballot token: On the admin page, generate ballot tokens for each voter. Each token is a unique secret link that grants access to one ballot.
Generate as many tokens as you have elig: Generate as many tokens as you have eligible voters. You can create tokens in batches.
Send each token link individually to the: Send each token link individually to the respective voter. The voter should redeem the token privately - only they will have access to their ballot.
Important: tokens can only be redeemed w: Important: tokens can only be redeemed while the election is open. The system ensures ballot anonymity: administrators cannot see which ballot corresponds to which token.
Track voting progress on the admin page. You can see how many tokens have been redeemed and how many ballots have been cast.
You cannot see how individual voters vot: You cannot see how individual voters voted. All ballots are anonymous once cast.
After the voting period ends, results ar: After the voting period ends, results are calculated automatically and published on the public election page.
The system shows elected candidates, Cop: The system shows elected candidates, Copeland ranking, detailed counting rounds, and the pairwise comparison matrix.
This guide is for election administrator: This guide is for election administrators - members of an electoral commission or individuals delegated by the commission to manage an election.
This is where election results are publi: This is where election results are published and voters can view election details. Safe to share publicly.
This page is created when you set up a n: This page is created when you set up a new election and provides full control: generate tokens, edit details, and manage voting. Share only with trusted administrators.
This ballot id does not exist: This ballot id does not exist
Ballot meta description: Cast your ballot in this STV election. Rank candidates by preference to participate in democratic decision-making.
Private Ballot: Do not share this page U: Private Ballot: Do not share this page URL with anyone. This link is unique to your vote and should be kept confidential.
Select your preferred rank for each cand: Select your preferred rank for each candidate. 1 is most preferred.
Number of seats must be between 1 and th: Number of seats must be between 1 and the number of candidates
Start and end times are required: Start and end times are required
End time must be after start time: End time must be after start time
Election Admin meta description: Administrative interface for managing elections. Create elections, generate ballot tokens, and monitor voting progress.
This page allows full control over the e: This page allows full control over the election. Only share this URL with people you trust to administer this election.
Title, description, and candidates are l: Title, description, and candidates are locked because voting tokens have been redeemed.
Each cell shows how many voters preferre: Each cell shows how many voters preferred the row candidate over the column candidate
Candidates are ordered by their final ra: Candidates are ordered by their final ranking (Copeland method). Green cells indicate wins, yellow indicates ties.
Results will be available after voting i: Results will be available after voting is complete
Elections meta description: Browse and participate in STV elections. View active elections, cast your ballot, and see transparent results.
Meta description: Secure, transparent, and auditable STV election platform. Run proportional representation elections with Meek's method, manage ballot tokens, and provide full result transparency.
Meta description short: Secure, transparent, and auditable STV election platform. Run proportional representation elections with Meek's method.
heroSubtitle: Fair, transparent, and proportional ranked-choice voting
createElectionDesc: Set up your own STV election. Define candidates, voting periods, and distribute secure ballot tokens to voters. Perfect for clubs, organizations, and communities.
participateDesc: Cast your vote in active elections using secure ballot links. Your choices are private and counted accurately using the STV algorithm.
experimentDesc: Try the interactive simulator to understand how STV works. Create your own elections, add candidates, and see results in real-time.
whatIsSTVPara1: Single Transferable Vote (STV) is a proportional voting system that ensures fair representation. Voters rank candidates in order of preference, and the algorithm ensures that votes are not wasted — if your top choice can't win or has already won, your vote transfers to your next preference.
whatIsSTVPara2: This makes STV ideal for electing multiple winners in a single contest, giving minority groups a fair chance while respecting majority preferences. It's used in real-world elections around the globe, from local councils to national legislatures.
technicalDetailsPara1: This website implements STV using Meek's method with the Droop quota, a precise and widely recognized algorithm for proportional ranked-choice elections. The underlying counting engine is open source, developed by Guillaume Endignoux, an engineer at Google.
technicalDetailsPara2: To provide a podium-style ranking of elected candidates, we augment the STV results using Copeland's method — a well-known approach based on pairwise comparison of preferences across all ballots. This means candidates are first selected by STV for fairness, then ordered according to voter preference strength.
technicalDetailsFooter: All election data, ballots, and detailed logs are published after voting closes, ensuring complete transparency and auditability.
readyToStartDesc: Browse active elections to cast your vote, or try the simulator to explore how STV works with your own scenarios.
numberOfSeatsInstructions:
Number of seats

Set how many candidates will be elected in this contest.
The value cannot be less than 1 or more than the total number of candidates.
Simulate meta description: Simulate STV elections with custom candidates and ballots. Test different scenarios and see detailed counting rounds and results.
addCandidatesInstructions:
Add your candidates

Enter candidate names below.
- Click Add Candidate to add more.
- Click Remove to delete a candidate.
- You can rename candidates at any time.
You can change the candidate's name here: You can change the candidate's name here.
At least one candidate is required: At least one candidate is required
Click to add a new candidate to the list: Click to add a new candidate to the list
editBallotsInstructions:
How to edit ballots:
- Enter the number of voters represented by each ballot.
- Rank the candidates (1 = first choice, 2 = second, ...); leave blank for "no preference".
- Candidates ranked equally are counted equally.
- Use Add Ballot group for new voting groups.
- Remove ballots you don't need.
loadSaveYamlInstructions:
Load/Save election YAML
Paste valid YAML to update the election setup.
Copy this field to export the current configuration.
Changes will apply automatically if the YAML is valid.
STV Explainer meta description: Learn how Single Transferable Vote (STV) works. Understand proportional representation, quota calculations, and the Meek method for fair elections.
stvMd.keyFeatureMinWaste: Minimizes the number of wasted votes
stvMd.keyFeatureComplex: At the expense of a more complicated counting method
stvMd.keyFeatureMinTactical: Reduces tactical voting: voters can honestly rank all preferences without fear of wasting their vote
stvMd.inputSeats: A number of seats to elect (`n`)
stvMd.inputVotes: A set of valid votes (total `t`), where each assigns a rank to any number of candidates.
stvMd.transferDefeated: When the highest preference is defeated, the vote is transferred to the next preference
stvMd.transferElected: When the highest preference is elected, the proportion of the vote not used to elect them is transferred to the next preference
stvMd.noWasteCaseMajority: a single candidate has a very high preference by the majority
stvMd.noWasteCaseMinority: a candidate has a very high preference by a minority
stvMd.refUNSW: University of New South Wales video on STV
stvMd.refElectoralCommission: Explanation of STV by Electoral Commission UK
stvMd.intro1: The STV-MD (Single Transferable Vote with Meek counting and Droop quota) method is a unimonial proportional representation voting system for multi-winner elections, combining Meek's iterative transfer algorithm with the Droop quota to fairly allocate seats and accurately reflect the voters' ranked preferences.
stvMd.intro2: It is used to elect N seats out of M candidates.
stvMd.inputsIntro: The method requires votes where voters rank candidates by preference. So, it needs:
stvMd.exampleVote1: vote 1: `[2, 1, None]` (Banana > Apple, no preference for Cherry)
stvMd.iterationsIntro2: At the start, each vote counts 1, and this value is assigned to the highest preference(s). On each iteration, candidates are either classified as defeated (lowest tally of highest preference among votes) or elected (above the threshold to be elected). When defeated or elected, the vote is transferred to the next candidate as follows:
stvMd.noWasteIntro: This ensures that votes on both cases where
stvMd.noWasteConclusion: are not wasted because, in both cases, the "remaining" of the vote is transferred to the vote's next preference.
Token Redeem meta description: Redeem your ballot token to access your voting page. This is your private link to cast your vote in the election.
This token has already been redeemed. Ea: This token has already been redeemed. Each token can only be used once. If you previously redeemed this token, you should have received a ballot link.
You have been invited to vote in this el: You have been invited to vote in this election. Click the button below to access your ballot.
Important: After continuing, you will re: Important: After continuing, you will receive a unique link to your ballot. This current link will no longer work. Do not share the ballot link with anyone, as it allows direct access to your vote.
